verses.kjv: Keep silence before me, O islands; and let the people renew their strength: let them come near; then let them speak: let us come near together to judgment.
verses.ct: "Be quiet in my presence, you coastlands! Let the nations gather their strength. Let them approach, and then let them make their case. Let us come together for judgment."

verses.kjv: Who raised up the righteous man from the east, called him to his foot, gave the nations before him, and made him rule over kings? he gave them as the dust to his sword, and as driven stubble to his bow.
verses.ct: "Who stirred up the righteous one from the east, summoning him into his service? He handed nations over to him and made him triumph over kings. His sword turned them to dust, and his bow scattered them like wind-blown straw."

verses.kjv: He pursued them, and passed safely; even by the way that he had not gone with his feet.
verses.ct: He chased them down and passed through safely, traveling paths his feet had never walked before.

verses.kjv: Who hath wrought and done it, calling the generations from the beginning? I the LORD, the first, and with the last; I am he.
verses.ct: Who has accomplished all this, calling each generation into existence from the very start? I, the LORD, am the first, and I will be there at the end. I am the one.

verses.kjv: The isles saw it, and feared; the ends of the earth were afraid, drew near, and came.
verses.ct: The coastlands witnessed it and trembled. The farthest corners of the earth shook with dread. They drew close and gathered together.

verses.kjv: They helped every one his neighbour; and every one said to his brother, Be of good courage.
verses.ct: Each one helped the other; everyone told their neighbor, "Stay strong!"

verses.kjv: So the carpenter encouraged the goldsmith, and he that smootheth with the hammer him that smote the anvil, saying, It is ready for the sodering: and he fastened it with nails, that it should not be moved.
verses.ct: The woodworker encouraged the metalsmith, and the one who smooths with the hammer cheered on the one who strikes the anvil, saying, "The soldering looks good." Then he secured it with nails so it wouldn't topple over.

verses.kjv: But thou, Israel, art my servant, Jacob whom I have chosen, the seed of Abraham my friend.
verses.ct: "But you, Israel, are my servant — Jacob, the one I chose, the descendant of Abraham, my friend.

verses.kjv: Thou whom I have taken from the ends of the earth, and called thee from the chief men thereof, and said unto thee, Thou art my servant; I have chosen thee, and not cast thee away.
verses.ct: I reached out and took you from the farthest parts of the earth. I called you from its most remote places and told you, 'You are my servant.' I chose you and have not rejected you.

verses.kjv: Fear thou not; for I am with thee: be not dismayed; for I am thy God: I will strengthen thee; yea, I will help thee; yea, I will uphold thee with the right hand of my righteousness.
verses.ct: Don't be afraid, because I am with you. Don't be discouraged, because I am your God. I will make you strong. Yes, I will help you. Yes, I will hold you up with my righteous right hand.

verses.kjv: Behold, all they that were incensed against thee shall be ashamed and confounded: they shall be as nothing; and they that strive with thee shall perish.
verses.ct: Look — everyone who raged against you will be put to shame and humiliated. Those who oppose you will become nothing and will disappear.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt seek them, and shalt not find them, even them that contended with thee: they that war against thee shall be as nothing, and as a thing of nought.
verses.ct: You will search for those who fought against you but won't find them. Those who waged war against you will be reduced to absolutely nothing.

verses.kjv: For I the LORD thy God will hold thy right hand, saying unto thee, Fear not; I will help thee.
verses.ct: Because I, the LORD your God, am holding your right hand. I am telling you, 'Don't be afraid. I will help you.'

verses.kjv: Fear not, thou worm Jacob, and ye men of Israel; I will help thee, saith the LORD, and thy redeemer, the Holy One of Israel.
verses.ct: Don't be afraid, little Jacob, and you people of Israel. I will help you," declares the LORD, your redeemer, the Holy One of Israel.

verses.kjv: Behold, I will make thee a new sharp threshing instrument having teeth: thou shalt thresh the mountains, and beat them small, and shalt make the hills as chaff.
verses.ct: "Look — I am going to turn you into a new, sharp threshing sledge with cutting edges. You will crush mountains and grind them to pieces. You will reduce the hills to chaff.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt fan them, and the wind shall carry them away, and the whirlwind shall scatter them: and thou shalt rejoice in the LORD, and shalt glory in the Holy One of Israel.
verses.ct: You will toss them in the air, and the wind will blow them away. A storm will scatter them in every direction. Then you will celebrate in the LORD and take pride in the Holy One of Israel."

verses.kjv: When the poor and needy seek water, and there is none, and their tongue faileth for thirst, I the LORD will hear them, I the God of Israel will not forsake them.
verses.ct: "When the poor and desperate search for water and find none, when their tongues are parched with thirst, I the LORD will respond to them. I, the God of Israel, will not abandon them.

verses.kjv: I will open rivers in high places, and fountains in the midst of the valleys: I will make the wilderness a pool of water, and the dry land springs of water.
verses.ct: I will cause rivers to flow on barren hilltops and springs to burst forth in the valleys. I will transform the desert into pools of water and turn dry ground into flowing springs.

verses.kjv: I will plant in the wilderness the cedar, the shittah tree, and the myrtle, and the oil tree; I will set in the desert the fir tree, and the pine, and the box tree together:
verses.ct: I will plant cedars, acacias, myrtles, and olive trees in the wilderness. I will fill the desert with cypress, elm, and pine trees together,

verses.kjv: That they may see, and know, and consider, and understand together, that the hand of the LORD hath done this, and the Holy One of Israel hath created it.
verses.ct: so that everyone may see, recognize, reflect on, and understand that the hand of the LORD has accomplished this, and the Holy One of Israel has created it."

verses.kjv: Produce your cause, saith the LORD; bring forth your strong reasons, saith the King of Jacob.
verses.ct: "Present your case," says the LORD. "Bring your best arguments," says the King of Jacob.

verses.kjv: Let them bring them forth, and shew us what shall happen: let them shew the former things, what they be, that we may consider them, and know the latter end of them; or declare us things for to come.
verses.ct: "Let them come forward and tell us what is going to happen. Let them explain past events so we can examine them and see how they turned out. Or let them announce what the future holds.

verses.kjv: Shew the things that are to come hereafter, that we may know that ye are gods: yea, do good, or do evil, that we may be dismayed, and behold it together.
verses.ct: Tell us what will happen next, so we can recognize that you are gods. Do something — whether good or bad — so that we can all witness it and be amazed.

verses.kjv: Behold, ye are of nothing, and your work of nought: an abomination is he that chooseth you.
verses.ct: Look at you — you are nothing, and your accomplishments amount to zero. Anyone who chooses you is disgusting.

verses.kjv: I have raised up one from the north, and he shall come: from the rising of the sun shall he call upon my name: and he shall come upon princes as upon morter, and as the potter treadeth clay.
verses.ct: I have raised up someone from the north, and he is coming. From the east, where the sun rises, he will call on my name. He will trample rulers like mortar, the way a potter stomps on clay.

verses.kjv: Who hath declared from the beginning, that we may know? and beforetime, that we may say, He is righteous? yea, there is none that sheweth, yea, there is none that declareth, yea, there is none that heareth your words.
verses.ct: Who announced this from the start so we could know? Who predicted it ahead of time so we could say, 'That was right'? Not one of you declared it. Not one of you foretold it. No one heard a word from you.

verses.kjv: The first shall say to Zion, Behold, behold them: and I will give to Jerusalem one that bringeth good tidings.
verses.ct: I was the first to say to Zion, 'Look — here they are!' And I am sending someone to Jerusalem with this good news.

verses.kjv: For I beheld, and there was no man; even among them, and there was no counsellor, that, when I asked of them, could answer a word.
verses.ct: When I looked, there was no one among them — not a single advisor who could give an answer when I questioned them.

verses.kjv: Behold, they are all vanity; their works are nothing: their molten images are wind and confusion.
verses.ct: Look at them all — they are worthless! Their works amount to nothing. Their metal idols are just empty wind and confusion."
